Arrangements of two or more rudders; Steering gear therefor

title-part.text: power driven, i.e. using steering engine
with alternative muscle or power operated steering
Transmitting of movement of initiating means to steering engine
Transmitting of movement of engine to rudder, e.g. using quadrants, brakes

reference.text: stern posts B63B3/40;

CPC-specific-text.text: rudders mounted on housing of outboard motors B63H20/34; rudders carrying propellers B63H25/42; rudders carrying jets B63H25/46
with flaps
movable otherwise than for steering purposes; Changing geometry
with deflecting means able to reverse the water stream direction
with means for retracting or lifting
by pivoting
by sliding, e.g. telescopic
comprising two or more rigidly interconnected mutually spaced blades pivotable about a common rudder shaft, e.g. parallel twin blades mounted on a pivotable supporting frame
with varying angle of attack over the height of the rudder blade, e.g. twisted rudders

title-part.text: Steering or dynamic anchoring by propulsive elements

reference.text: by jets B63H25/46

title-part.text: Steering or dynamic anchoring by propellers used therefor only
Steering or dynamic anchoring by rudders carrying propellers

CPC-specific-text.text: Propulsive elements, other than jets, substantially used for steering or dynamic anchoring only, with means for retracting, or otherwise moving to a rest position outside the water flow around the hull

title-part.text: Steering or slowing-down by extensible flaps or the like
Steering or dynamic anchoring by jets

CPC-specific-text.text: or by rudders carrying jets

reference.text: steering or dynamic anchoring by deflecting or directing main propulsion jets B63H11/00

CPC-specific-text.text: Jets or thrusters substantially used for steering or dynamic anchoring only, with means for retracting, or otherwise moving to a rest position outside the water flow around the hull

title-part.text: Steering or slowing-down by deflection of propeller slipstream otherwise than by rudder
Slowing-down means not otherwise provided for
Parts for steering not otherwise provided for
